attributes.action: Force council/housing association tenants to downsize.
attributes.additional_details: I would like this changed as I myself am in this position I have a small 2 bed house and have a child off to high school in September I have no space for her to have a computer or study away from her sister. I have tried to swap on many occasions to no avail. the last lady who looked like she might swap with us was living alone in a 4 bed property. This just seems crazy to me why are they not forced to move. They only need 1 spare bedroom maximum for guests or hobbies etc.
attributes.background: When a council or housing association tenant has more than one spare room they should be forced to downsize. There are many families who are waiting for bigger homes. There's a problem with older people living in 3/4 bed properties just one person or one couple.

rejection.details:
Decisions about the suitability of tenants for properties owned by housing associations or local authorities are a matter for them, not the UK Government or Parliament.

If you wanted the Government to fund the building of more social housing, you could start a petition about that.
